sentences.en: Henry was horrified by what had happened.
sentences.cn: 亨利对所发生的事感到毛骨悚然。

sentences.en: His family was horrified by the change.
sentences.cn: 他的家人对这一变化感到震惊。

sentences.en: Such sentiments might horrify some corporate executives.
sentences.cn: 这种热情可能会让一些公司高管大为惊骇.

sentences.en: Such things did not appear to horrify her.
sentences.cn: 这样的事情她却不震惊.

words.tran_cn: 令人恐惧的；使人惊骇的
令人恐惧地；叫人毛骨悚然地
惊骇；惨状；极端厌恶；令人恐怖的事物
惊骇（horrify的过去式和过去分词）；使…战悚
令人恐惧；使人毛骨悚然（horrify的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 使恐惧；惊骇；使极度厌恶
trans.tran_en: If someone is horrified, they feel shocked or disgusted, usually because of something that they have seen or heard
to make someone feel very shocked and upset or afraid
